intro: Meeboldia linearis, commonly known as the slender meebold, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its linear, elongated leaves and showy, pale yellow to orange flowers that bloom in clusters. Native to South America, particularly Brazil, it thrives in tropical and subtropical climates. The plant is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and riverbanks. Its botanical features make it a unique subject for study in botany and horticulture.
